FuncDef:
The damp-interface level command configures a suppression level for a flapping interface.
The undo damp-interface level command restores the default setting.

By default, a flapping interface is suppressed at a light level.
CLIs: damp-interface level { light | middle | heavy | manual { <half-life-period> <suppress> <reuse> <max-suppress-time> } }
undo damp-interface level { middle | heavy | manual }

ParaDef.Info:
Indicates that a flapping interface is suppressed at a light level.
The value are as follows:
             
half-life-period:11
suppress:7700
reuse:6000
max-suppress-time:10

Indicates that a flapping interface is suppressed at a middle level.
The value are as follows:
             
half-life-period:16
suppress:5500
reuse:4300
max-suppress-time:12

Indicates that a flapping interface is suppressed at a heavy level.
The value are as follows:
             
half-life-period:25
suppress:3500
reuse:2700
max-suppress-time:18

Indicates that a flapping interface is manually suppressed.
The value ranges are as follows:
             
half-life-period:1~60
suppress:1~20000
reuse:1~20000
max-suppress-time:1~255

Specifies a half-life period for a penalty value.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 60, in seconds.

Specifies a suppression value, which is 1000 times the suppression threshold of an interface. The interface is suppressed when the penalty value (inceased by 1 each time the interface goes down) is greater than the suppression value.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 20000. The suppress value must be greater than the reuse value.

Specifies a reuse value, which is 1000 times the reuse threshold of an interface. The interface is no longer suppressed when the penalty value (inceased by 1 each time the interface goes down) is less than the reuse value.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 20000. The reuse value must be less than the suppress value.

Specifies the maximum suppression time.
The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 255, in seconds.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario


        Intermittent disconnection of an optical fiber connected to a physical interface causes the interface status to alternate frequently between Up and Down. The damp-interface function can suppress a flapping interface at the physical layer. Therefore, stability of the entire link layer and network layer is guaranteed. When damp-interface is enabled, run the damp-interface level command to configure a light, middle, or heavy suppression based on damp-interface requirements:
        
Light: If a light damp-interface is configured, status flapping suppression is triggered only when the interface flaps frequently and rapidly.
Heavy: If a heavy damp-interface is configured, status flapping suppression is triggered even if the interface does not flap severely. This is, a flapping interface tends to be easily suppressed.
Middle: Intensity of the middle damp-interface is between the light and heavy damp-interfaces.
Manual: When the light, middle, heavy levels fail to meet suppression requires, you can specify this parameter to manually control the suppression level.



Prerequisites

Status flapping suppression has been enabled on a physical interface using the damp-interface enable command.
